item.title: Can I Use My Parents’ Address to Get Our Kids Into a Better School?
item.description: I feel guilty about the lie we’d have to keep up, but we would be much happier.

item.title: Can You Compel Your Children to Sing for Their Snacks?
item.description: A ruling on an unusual postconcert tradition.

item.title: Simon Cowell Is Sorry, Softer and Grieving Liam Payne
item.description: The music mogul has mellowed as he thinks about his legacy.

item.title: The Shocking Crash That Led One County to Reckon With the Dangers of E-Bikes
item.description: Unregulated e-bikes are a growing danger on American streets. In one Bay Area town, a terrible accident finally led to reform.

item.title: A Rich Chickpea Stew That Tastes Like an Oasis
item.description: A writer in Afghanistan finds momentary peace in saland-e nakhod.

item.title: A Revived War Documentary, Backed by Steve Bannon, Can’t Decide What It Believes
item.description: The 2008 film on the Iraq war, deemed too pro-military at the time, has now been labeled antiwar. Can both be true?

item.title: My Father Had an Affair While My Mother Was Dying. Should I Tell My Siblings?
item.description: I get that peeking at his emails was an invasion of privacy, but it is not something I can unsee.

item.title: Can You Grab Seats Before Ordering Your Food?
item.description: A ruling on a counter-service dispute.

item.title: Kristen Stewart Wants to Blow Up the Myth of the Brilliant Male Actor
item.description: The actress and director says the world of filmmaking needs a “full system break.”

item.title: What Should I Do About the Bully in My Social Circle?
item.description: I know from experience that any vulnerability I expose will be used by this person.

item.title: A.I. Actors Might Change Your View of Human Ones
item.description: Even the stars people think of as immaculately crafted Hollywood products look wildly, irreducibly human in comparison.

item.title: Is It OK to Break Up With a Troubled Friend?
item.description: At what point is stepping back self-protection rather than abandonment?

item.title: We Asked 10 of the Year’s Best Actors How They Conjure Feelings on Cue
item.description: Teyana Taylor, Liam Neeson, Rose Byrne and more of our best actors on how they summon the emotions that move us.

item.title: This Year’s Film Performances Were So Good, We Had To Invent New Awards
item.description: Best Acting in a Helmet, Best Nervous Breakdown, Craziest Charm—the film performances so good Wesley Morris had to invent his own categories.
